intro: Hieracium sauzei, commonly known as the alpine hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky habitats, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are usually basal, spoon-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with ray florets. Hieracium sauzei is often found in high-altitude areas, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
